refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: a GstRTSPMedia contains the complete GStreamer pipeline to manage the streaming to the clients. The actual data transfer is done by the GstRTSPStream objects that are created and exposed by the GstRTSPMedia.
The GstRTSPMedia is usually created from a GstRTSPMediaFactory when the client does a DESCRIBE or SETUP of a resource.

A media is created with gst_rtsp_media_new() that takes the element that will provide the streaming elements. For each of the streams, a new GstRTSPStream object needs to be made with the gst_rtsp_media_create_stream() which takes the payloader element and the source pad that produces the RTP stream.

The pipeline of the media is set to PAUSED with gst_rtsp_media_prepare(). The prepare method will add rtpbin and sinks and sources to send and receive RTP and RTCP packets from the clients. Each stream srcpad is connected to an input into the internal rtpbin.
It is also possible to dynamically create GstRTSPStream objects during the prepare phase. With gst_rtsp_media_get_status() you can check the status of the prepare phase.
After the media is prepared, it is ready for streaming. It will usually be managed in a session with gst_rtsp_session_manage_media(). See GstRTSPSession and GstRTSPSessionMedia.
The state of the media can be controlled with gst_rtsp_media_set_state(). Seeking can be done with gst_rtsp_media_seek().
With gst_rtsp_media_unprepare() the pipeline is stopped and shut down. When gst_rtsp_media_set_eos_shutdown() an EOS will be sent to the pipeline to cleanly shut down.
With gst_rtsp_media_set_shared(), the media can be shared between multiple clients. With gst_rtsp_media_set_reusable() you can control if the pipeline can be prepared again after an unprepare.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_new ()
refsect2.para: Create a new GstRTSPMedia instance. element is the bin element that provides the different streams. The GstRTSPMedia object contains the element to produce RTP data for one or more related (audio/video/..) streams.
Ownership is taken of element .

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_get_element ()
refsect2.para: Get the element that was used when constructing media .

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_take_pipeline ()
refsect2.para: Set pipeline as the GstPipeline for media . Ownership is taken of pipeline .

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_set_permissions ()
refsect2.para: Set permissions on media .

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_get_permissions ()
refsect2.para: Get the permissions object from media .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a GstRTSPPermissions object, unref after usage.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_set_shared ()
refsect2.para: Set or unset if the pipeline for media can be shared will multiple clients. When shared is TRUE, client requests for this media will share the media pipeline.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_is_shared ()
refsect2.para: Check if the pipeline for media can be shared between multiple clients.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the media can be shared between clients.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_set_reusable ()
refsect2.para: Set or unset if the pipeline for media can be reused after the pipeline has been unprepared.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_is_reusable ()
refsect2.para: Check if the pipeline for media can be reused after an unprepare.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the media can be reused

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_set_profiles ()
refsect2.para: Configure the allowed lower transport for media .

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_get_profiles ()
refsect2.para: Get the allowed profiles of media .

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_set_protocols ()
refsect2.para: Configure the allowed lower transport for media .

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_get_protocols ()
refsect2.para: Get the allowed protocols of media .

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_set_eos_shutdown ()
refsect2.para: Set or unset if an EOS event will be sent to the pipeline for media before it is unprepared.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_is_eos_shutdown ()
refsect2.para: Check if the pipeline for media will send an EOS down the pipeline before unpreparing.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the media will send EOS before unpreparing.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_set_address_pool ()
refsect2.para: configure pool to be used as the address pool of media .

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_get_address_pool ()
refsect2.para: Get the GstRTSPAddressPool used as the address pool of media .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the GstRTSPAddressPool of media . g_object_unref() after usage.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_set_buffer_size ()
refsect2.para: Set the kernel UDP buffer size.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_get_buffer_size ()
refsect2.para: Get the kernel UDP buffer size.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_set_retransmission_time ()
refsect2.para: Set the amount of time to store retransmission packets.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_get_retransmission_time ()
refsect2.para: Get the amount of time to store retransmission data.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the amount of time to store retransmission data.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_set_latency ()
refsect2.para: Configure the latency used for receiving media.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_get_latency ()
refsect2.para: Get the latency that is used for receiving media.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_setup_sdp ()
refsect2.para: Add media specific info to sdp . info is used to configure the connection information in the SDP.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_handle_sdp ()
refsect2.para: Configure an SDP on media for receiving streams

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_prepare ()
refsect2.para: Prepare media for streaming. This function will create the objects to manage the streaming. A pipeline must have been set on media with gst_rtsp_media_take_pipeline().
It will preroll the pipeline and collect vital information about the streams such as the duration.

entry.para: a GstRTSPThread to run the bus handler or NULL.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_unprepare ()
refsect2.para: Unprepare media . After this call, the media should be prepared again before it can be used again. If the media is set to be non-reusable, a new instance must be created.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_get_status ()
refsect2.para: Get the status of media . When media is busy preparing, this function waits until media is prepared or in error.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_set_suspend_mode ()
refsect2.para: Control how @ media will be suspended after the SDP has been generated and after a PAUSE request has been performed.
Media must be unprepared when setting the suspend mode.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_get_suspend_mode ()
refsect2.para: Get how media will be suspended.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_suspend ()
refsect2.para: Suspend media . The state of the pipeline managed by media is set to GST_STATE_NULL but all streams are kept. media can be prepared again with gst_rtsp_media_unsuspend()
media must be prepared with gst_rtsp_media_prepare();

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_unsuspend ()
refsect2.para: Unsuspend media if it was in a suspended state. This method does nothing when the media was not in the suspended state.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_collect_streams ()
refsect2.para: Find all payloader elements, they should be named pay%d in the element of media , and create GstRTSPStreams for them.
Collect all dynamic elements, named dynpay%d, and add them to the list of dynamic elements.
Find all depayloader elements, they should be named depay%d in the element of media , and create GstRTSPStreams for them.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_create_stream ()
refsect2.para: Create a new stream in media that provides RTP data on pad . pad should be a pad of an element inside media->element .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a new GstRTSPStream that remains valid for as long as media exists.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_n_streams ()
refsect2.para: Get the number of streams in this media.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_get_stream ()
refsect2.para: Retrieve the stream with index idx from media .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the GstRTSPStream at index idx or NULL when a stream with that index did not exist.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_find_stream ()
refsect2.para: Find a stream in media with control as the control uri.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the GstRTSPStream with control uri control or NULL when a stream with that control did not exist.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_seek ()
refsect2.para: Seek the pipeline of media to range . media must be prepared with gst_rtsp_media_prepare().

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_get_range_string ()
refsect2.programlisting: gchar * gst_rtsp_media_get_range_string (GstRTSPMedia *media, gboolean play, GstRTSPRangeUnit unit);
refsect2.para: Get the current range as a string. media must be prepared with gst_rtsp_media_prepare().

entry.para: the unit to use for the string

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The range as a string, g_free() after usage.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_set_state ()
refsect2.para: Set the state of media to state and for the transports in transports .
media must be prepared with gst_rtsp_media_prepare();

entry.para: the target state of the media

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_set_pipeline_state ()
refsect2.para: Set the state of the pipeline managed by media to state

entry.para: the target state of the pipeline

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_get_clock ()
refsect2.para: Get the clock that is used by the pipeline in media .
media must be prepared before this method returns a valid clock object.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the GstClock used by media . unref after usage.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_get_base_time ()
refsect2.para: Get the base_time that is used by the pipeline in media .
media must be prepared before this method returns a valid base_time.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_use_time_provider ()
refsect2.para: Set media to provide a GstNetTimeProvider.

entry.para: if a GstNetTimeProvider should be used

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_is_time_provider ()
refsect2.para: Check if media can provide a GstNetTimeProvider for its pipeline clock.
Use gst_rtsp_media_get_time_provider() to get the network clock.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if media can provide a GstNetTimeProvider.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_media_get_time_provider ()
refsect2.para: Get the GstNetTimeProvider for the clock used by media . The time provider will listen on address and port for client time requests.

refsect2.title: struct GstRTSPMedia
refsect2.para: A class that contains the GStreamer element along with a list of GstRTSPStream objects that can produce data.
This object is usually created from a GstRTSPMediaFactory.

refsect2.title: struct GstRTSPMediaClass
refsect2.para: The RTSP media class

entry.para: the default implementation adds all elements and sets the pipeline's state to GST_STATE_PAUSED (or GST_STATE_PLAYING in case of NO_PREROLL elements).
the default implementation sets the pipeline's state to GST_STATE_NULL and removes all elements.
the default implementation sets the pipeline's state to GST_STATE_NULL GST_STATE_PAUSED depending on the selected suspend mode.
the default implementation reverts the suspend operation. The pipeline will be prerolled again if it's state was set to GST_STATE_NULL in suspend.
convert a range to the given unit
query the current position in the pipeline

refsect2.title: enum GstRTSPMediaStatus
refsect2.para: The state of the media pipeline.

entry.para: media pipeline is busy doing a clean shutdown.

refsect2.title: enum GstRTSPSuspendMode
refsect2.para: The suspend mode of the media pipeline. A media pipeline is suspended right after creating the SDP and when the client performs a PAUSED request.

entry.para: The media is set to NULL when suspended

refsect2.title: The buffer-size property
refsect2.para: The kernel UDP buffer size to use.
Flags: Read / Write
Default value: 524288

refsect2.title: The clock property
refsect2.para: Clock to be used by the media pipeline.
Flags: Read / Write

refsect2.title: The element property
refsect2.para: The GstBin to use for streaming the media.
Flags: Read / Write / Construct Only

refsect2.title: The eos-shutdown property
refsect2.para: Send an EOS event to the pipeline before unpreparing.
Flags: Read / Write
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The latency property
refsect2.para: Latency used for receiving media in milliseconds.
Flags: Read / Write
Default value: 524288

refsect2.title: The profiles property
refsect2.para: Allowed transfer profiles.
Flags: Read / Write
Default value: GST_RTSP_PROFILE_AVP

refsect2.title: The protocols property
refsect2.para: Allowed lower transport protocols.
Flags: Read / Write
Default value: GST_RTSP_LOWER_TRANS_UDP | GST_RTSP_LOWER_TRANS_UDP_MCAST | GST_RTSP_LOWER_TRANS_TCP

refsect2.title: The reusable property
refsect2.para: If this media pipeline can be reused after an unprepare.
Flags: Read / Write
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The shared property
refsect2.para: If this media pipeline can be shared.
Flags: Read / Write
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The stop-on-disconnect property
refsect2.para: If this media pipeline should be stopped when a client disconnects without TEARDOWN.
Flags: Read / Write
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The suspend-mode property
refsect2.para: How to suspend the media in PAUSED.
Flags: Read / Write
Default value: GST_RTSP_SUSPEND_MODE_NONE

refsect2.title: The time-provider property
refsect2.para: Use a NetTimeProvider for clients.
Flags: Read / Write
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The transport-mode property
refsect2.para: If this media pipeline can be used for PLAY or RECORD.
Flags: Read / Write
Default value: GST_RTSP_TRANSPORT_MODE_PLAY

refsect2.title: The new-state signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GstRTSPMedia *gstrtspmedia, gint arg1, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Flags: Run Last

refsect2.title: The new-stream signal
refsect2.para: Flags: Run Last

refsect2.title: The prepared signal
refsect2.para: Flags: Run Last

refsect2.title: The removed-stream signal
refsect2.para: Flags: Run Last

refsect2.title: The target-state signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GstRTSPMedia *gstrtspmedia, gint arg1, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Flags: Run Last

refsect2.title: The unprepared signal
refsect2.para: Flags: Run Last
